projects.title: Research project on Salafism in Egypt and Tunisia
projects.description:
Personal research project on the attractiveness of Salafist thought in Egypt and Tunisia after the Arab Spring, made possible by the Radboud Honours Academy.

Published the results in a research report and in an article in ZemZem, Journal on the Middle East and North-Africa. 

Supervisor: Dr. Martijn de Koning

Project led to the awarding of a Radboud BA Honours Certificate.

projects.title: Wunderkammer Project
projects.description:
Project under the auspices of the royal academy of arts (KNAW) to foster interaction between the arts and sciences.

Culminated in a research trip to New York and Boston, with meetings at a.o. Harvard and Boston University.

profile_positions.title: Policy Officer International Cultural Policy

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
Member Strategy Team, Directorate for Industrial Policy

Responsibilities:
* Strategic Industrial Policy
* Secretary CFEI/RFEI
* Parliamentary Coordination
* Crisisteam Ukraine
* Vision 2050
* Coordinator Topsectors
* Business and Human Rights (IMVO, MVI, CSRD, CSDDD, SER-committee)
* SDG Focal Point
profile_positions.title: (Senior) Policy Officer Industrial Strategy and Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Internship at the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Department of Sustainable Economic Development (BZ/DDE). My primary dossier was the revision of the Dutch National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights. (B&HR)

I also worked on the provisional UN Treaty for B&HR, proposals for the EU Action Plan B&HR and made minor contributions to the work of colleagues on e.g. sustainable cacao and palm oil.

* Co-wrote the Dutch government's response to the national baseline assessment and other memos
* Carried out stakeholder consultations
* Project management and communication
* Background research
profile_positions.title: Graduate Intern Sustainable Economic Development, Business and Human Rights

profile_positions.description: Consultancy project to support the Royal Dutch Military Airforce Academy (KMSL) in the digitalization of its continuous development track of non-commissioned officers. Aimed at the effective transfer of soft skills through digital education methods, necessitated by the reduction of physical education due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  Interdisciplinary group assignment with students from across the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Digital Education

profile_positions.description: Club and heavyweight varsity rower. Full training schedule (20+ hours) next to my academic education. Competed at the national level. Also rowed for ALSRV Asopos de Vliet and King's College London Boat Club and coached other crews.
profile_positions.title: Club and Varsity Rower

profile_positions.description:
* Housekeeping and social care
* Diverse social interaction | working independently
* Professionally respond and adapt to diverse circumstances
profile_positions.title: Home Care Worker

profile_positions.description:
Treasurer on the board of the Young Labour's Chapter in the Hague & Leiden.

* Responsible for the chapter's finances
* Organization of (in)formal activities | educate on politics in schools
* Communicate with the national board and external institutions for e.g. financing
* Professionally represent a local political party | enhanced communication skills | experience with accounting
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description: Temporary position to assist with the presentation of Dr. Alanna O'Malley's research agenda for her appointment as Chair of UN Studies in Peace and Justice.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description: Wide variety of activities, including but not limited to hospitality, basic logistics, the provision of information, sharing my personal experience during open days and mentoring freshers during introduction.
profile_positions.title: Student Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
Personal research project on the attractiveness of Salafist thought in Egypt and Tunisia after the Arab Spring, made possible by the Radboud Honours Academy.

Published the results in a research report and in an article in ZemZem, Journal on the Middle East and North-Africa. Also gained broad experience with public presentations of academic research and followed extra courses in research methodology.

Supervisor: Dr. Martijn de Koning

Project led to the awarding of a Radboud BA Honours Certificate.
profile_positions.title: Student Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: Member of the Harvard Business Review Advisory Council, an opt-in research community of business professionals.

* Liaise with the Cambridge University Student Union to address College and University-wide issues and lobby for student welfare.
* Responsible for relations, communication and events with other Cambridge Colleges. This includes learning from the different ways Colleges approach student concerns and organizing (digital) College swaps.

Member of the advisory committee, which supports and advises the club's board and general assembly on club policies. Experience with long term planning, finance, performance sport and association structures.

Responsible for the registration of all new members during our introduction period. Functioned as the central communicator between the board, our existing members, new members and external parties.

* High degree of multi-tasking and time management capability.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Integrity and professionalism.
* Proficiency in MS Office.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member Annual Student Council BA History
volunteer_experiences.description: Annual council of students and lecturers to evaluate the courses of the BA history and advice the education committee on possible improvements.
